page.title: 07Churches-Easton
page.content: The first record of{St.Swithun's {Church,Martyr Worthy}is in 1251 and in the churchyard there is a tomb of a Crusader which dates from that time. There used to be a gallery into which two dogs were smuggled to attend services with their masters but it was removed in 1911.The church shares a vicar with St.Mary's at Easton and is very active with as many as 60 people attending morning service. {St.Mary's Easton}is mentioned in the Domesday Book and dates from 1120-1170.Set in beautiful surroudings, it is obviously much loved and an important part of the community.
